column4: try to add this entry to /etc/network/interfaces:  dns-nameservers DNSIPHERE
put somewhere in the interface declaration

btw if you do: echo nameserver IPHERE > /etc/resolv.conf  will do the job.. but if resolvconf package is installed.. will reset your config on reboot. (the first solution is the right one to systems with resolvconf package, as ubuntu edgy)
remeber only root can do it. If you aren't root. try su or sudo .
